summary:
O assunto da petição é a falta de medicamentos para tratar pacientes com Doença de Alzheimer no Rio Grande do Norte. O Ministério Público do Estado do Rio Grande do Norte afirma que a Secretaria de Estado da Saúde do Rio Grande do Norte não está fornecendo o medicamento Galantamina, destinado a pacientes portadores da Doença de Alzheimer, apesar de ter sido incluído no protocolo assistencial do Ministério da Saúde. O autor também apresenta diversas solicitações de médicos do Estado que solicitaram a inclusão da droga Galantamina para atendimento do público específico portador da doença de Alzheimer.

Então, o assunto da petição é a falta de medicamentos para tratar pacientes com Doença de Alzheimer no Rio Grande do Norte e os fatos descritos são:

* A Secretaria de Estado da Saúde do Rio Grande do Norte não está fornecendo o medicamento Galantamina para pacientes com Doença de Alzheimer, apesar de ter sido incluído no protocolo assistencial do Ministério da Saúde.
* Diversos médicos do Estado solicitaram a inclusão da droga Galantamina para atendimento do público específico portador da doença de Alzheimer.

The Ministério Público do Estado do Rio Grande do Norte filed a petition to include Galantamina in the list of medications dispensed by the State Health Secretariat of Rio Grande do Norte for the treatment of Alzheimer's disease. They argue that the State has a legal obligation to provide this medication to patients who need it, as it is necessary to ensure the effective enjoyment of the right to health, particularly for the elderly population. The petitioner presents several facts to support their request, including the high prevalence of Alzheimer's disease in the state, the lack of effectiveness of the current medication available, scientific studies that recommend the use of Galantamina, and the request for inclusion made by physicians and neurologists. The petitioner also notes that the State Health Secretariat has not provided any scientific or medical justification for not including Galantamina in the list of medications.

The initial petitioner, Leonardo Castro Maia, requests the Governor of Governador Valadares, Minas Gerais, Brazil, to take measures to ensure accessibility for people with disabilities in public buildings, specifically in the 10th Justice Court of Governador Valadares. The petitioner argues that the building's architecture and obstacles prevent people with disabilities from accessing the court, violating their constitutional rights. The petitioner also mentions that the building's accessibility is necessary to ensure the rights of people with disabilities to education, health, work, leisure, social security, and other rights that promote their personal, social, and economic well-being.

The petitioner requests the Governor to order the construction of a ramp or platform to ensure accessibility for people with disabilities and to impose a fine of R$500.00 per day until the building is made accessible. The petitioner also requests the Governor to cite the respondent to contest the present action and to determine the respondent's liability for the costs and expenses of the proceedings.

The petitioner bases their request on Law No. 10,098/00, which ensures accessibility for people with disabilities in public buildings, and on the obligation of the public power to ensure the full exercise of the rights of people with disabilities.

In another petition, Maria Margareth Pimenta, requests the 10th District Court of Governador Valadares/MG to take appropriate measures to ensure accessibility for people with physical disabilities to a commercial establishment located at Rua Marechal Floriano, n. 2247, loja 1, bairro de Lourdes, in the city of Governador Valadares/MG. The petitioner claims that the establishment does not provide autonomous access for people with physical disabilities, which is a violation of their rights as stated in the Brazilian Constitution and Law 8.625/93. The petitioner also mentions that the Ministry of Public Prosecution, in compliance with its duties to defend the rights of people with disabilities, has manifested its opinion in accordance with the Portaria n. 283/2005 of the Chief Cabinet of the State Prosecutor's Office of Minas Gerais. The petitioner requests the court to order the establishment to make the necessary adaptations to ensure accessibility for people with physical disabilities.

In summary, both petitions aim to ensure accessibility for people with disabilities in public buildings and commercial establishments in Governador Valadares, Minas Gerais, Brazil. The petitioners argue that the lack of accessibility violates the rights of people with disabilities and request the authorities to take measures to ensure accessibility, citing relevant laws and regulations.

O assunto da petição é a falta de acessibilidade para pessoas com deficiência em um estabelecimento comercial em Governador Valadares, Minas Gerais. O autor, Leonardo Castro Maia, Promotor de Justiça, pede a eliminação de barreiras físicas e arquitetônicas que impedem ou dificultam a acessibilidade de pessoas com deficiência ou mobilidade reduzida no local. Ele também baseia sua petição na Lei n. 10.098/00 e na Constituição Federal, que estabelecem o direito à acessibilidade e à igualdade para todas as pessoas, independentemente de suas condições físicas. O autor destaca que a acessibilidade é importante para garantir o pleno exercício dos direitos básicos das pessoas com deficiência e para evitar exclusão social e discriminação. A ação visa à indefinição da responsável pela falta de acessibilidade no local e pede a construção de uma rampa ou a instalação de uma plataforma móvel de percurso para garantir o acesso autônomo das pessoas portadoras de deficiência ao estabelecimento.
